duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate and maintain organized patient flow.
Perform patient intake procedures: vital signs, height and weight, reason for visit, interim history, allergies, medication lists, and other interventions.
Prepare patients for exams based on the reason for the visit.
Prepare and support patients and assist providers with procedures.
Administer immunizations as ordered by Physician.
Clean, prepare, and stock exam rooms, treatment rooms, and workstations.
Call patients regarding test results and medical instruction under the direction of a Physician.
Assist with scheduling patient tests, procedures, and follow-up appointments.
Assist in the care, cleaning, and sterilization of equipment and instruments.
Maintain the inventory of medical and linen supplies.
Provide cross-coverage to other clinical areas as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Current Clinical Medical Assistant Certification by AAMA, AMT, NCCT, NAHP, or NHA (includes principles and techniques of injections and medication administration) required
Graduate of an Accredited Medical Assistant Program is required
Current CPR BLS Certification (Red Cross or AHA only)
Minimum of one year clinical experience preferred
Computer Skills Required, Epic Ambulatory Experience Preferred
